channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cloud Security
channel.description: Latest cloud security threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Finance Execs Targeted in Sophisticated LinkedIn Phishing Scheme with Fake Board Invites
item.description:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting finance executives through LinkedIn direct messages, using fake invitations to an executive board as a lure. The multi-stage attack, detailed by Push Security, aims to harvest Microsoft credentials and session cookies to bypass MFA. The attack chain lev...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: EY Leaks 4TB+ SQL Database Packed with Corporate Secrets via Cloud Misconfiguration
item.description:
Consulting giant EY (Ernst & Young) inadvertently exposed a massive, 4TB+ SQL Server backup file to the public internet due to a cloud storage misconfiguration. The unencrypted `.BAK` file, discovered by researchers at Neo Security, contained a treasure trove of highly sensitive internal data, inclu...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Shadow Escape": New Zero-Click Attack Steals Data from ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini
item.description:
A novel zero-click attack vector named "Shadow Escape" has been discovered by researchers at Operant, capable of silently exfiltrating sensitive data from popular AI agents like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, and Google's Gemini. The attack exploits the Model Context Protocol (MCP) by embeddi...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive 70TB Data Leak at Tata Motors from Exposed AWS Keys
item.description:
A colossal security failure at Tata Motors has resulted in the exposure of over 70 terabytes of sensitive corporate data, customer information, and infrastructure details. The breach, which was first identified in 2023, stemmed from multiple critical misconfigurations, including plaintext Amazon Web...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive Breach at Kenyan Health Platform M-TIBA Exposes 4.8 Million Patients
item.description:
A threat actor named 'Kazu' has claimed responsibility for a catastrophic data breach against M-TIBA, a major mobile health platform in Kenya backed by Safaricom. The hacker alleges the theft of 2.15 terabytes of data, impacting up to 4.8 million users. The compromised information reportedly include...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: ChatGPT Flaw Allows 'Memory Poisoning' via CSRF Attack
item.description:
A novel vulnerability discovered in OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas web browser allows attackers to perform 'memory poisoning' through a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack. Researchers at LayerX Security found that this flaw can be used to invisibly inject malicious instructions into ChatGPT's persiste...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: AWS Outage in us-east-1 Knocks Major Global Services Offline
item.description:
A significant infrastructure fault within Amazon Web Services' (AWS) us-east-1 region in North Virginia on October 20, 2025, triggered a global outage affecting numerous major online services. Platforms including Snapchat, Fortnite, Disney Plus, and various banking applications experienced widesprea...

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive Supply Chain Risk Found in VSCode Marketplace; 100+ Extensions Leaked Access Tokens
item.description:
Researchers at Wiz have discovered a significant supply chain risk in the popular VSCode and OpenVSX extension marketplaces. They found that publishers of over 100 extensions had inadvertently leaked their access tokens, which could have allowed attackers to hijack the extensions and distribute malw...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Vulnerability, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'LinkPro' Linux Rootkit Uses eBPF and 'Magic Packets' for Ultimate Stealth
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered a sophisticated new GNU/Linux rootkit named 'LinkPro' after investigating a compromised AWS environment. The malware demonstrates advanced stealth capabilities by leveraging extended Berkeley Packet Filter (eBPF) modules to hide its processes and files from securi...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cloud Security
